docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's nominee to run the department overseeing the U.S. government's health programs for the elderly and disabled won the backing of a Senate committee on Thursday, paving the way for a full vote in the Senate....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump's nominee to run the department overseeing the U.S. government's health programs for the elderly and disabled won the backing of a Senate committee on Thursday, paving the way for a full vote in the Senate.

headline.main: Senate Committee Backs Trump Pick to Run Medicare, Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Senate Committee Backs Trump Pick to Run Medicare, Medicaid

docs.snippet: Gregory Havret came storming out early on Thursday in the opening round of the Tshwane Open at the Pretoria Country Club, but his blistering 65 was later matched by South Africa’s Haydn Porteous and Swedish rookie Alexander Bjork to ensure a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gregory Havret came storming out early on Thursday in the opening round of the Tshwane Open at the Pretoria Country Club, but his blistering 65 was later matched by South Africa’s Haydn Porteous and Swedish rookie Alexander Bjork to ensure a three-way tie for the lead.

headline.main: Havret Makes Quick Start to Share Three-Way Lead at Tshwane Open
headline.print_headline: Havret Makes Quick Start to Share Three-Way Lead at Tshwane Open

docs.snippet: The Golden State Warriors have signed forward Matt Barnes, adding the edgy veteran after losing Kevin Durant to a knee injury....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Golden State Warriors have signed forward Matt Barnes, adding the edgy veteran after losing Kevin Durant to a knee injury.

headline.main: Warriors Sign Veteran Barnes to Replace Injured Durant
headline.print_headline: Warriors Sign Veteran Barnes to Replace Injured Durant

docs.snippet: The Navy has found that members of a special warfare unit violated regulations when their military vehicle displayed a Donald Trump presidential campaign flag while training in Kentucky....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Navy has found that members of a special warfare unit violated regulations when their military vehicle displayed a Donald Trump presidential campaign flag while training in Kentucky.

headline.main: Navy: 'Corrective Measures' Taken After Trump Flag Display
headline.print_headline: Navy: 'Corrective Measures' Taken After Trump Flag Display

docs.snippet: A senior Senate Democrat is asking the Treasury Department to evaluate whether President Donald Trump and his family's business associates and possible investors from Russia and other countries have violated U.S. laws against financing terrorism, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A senior Senate Democrat is asking the Treasury Department to evaluate whether President Donald Trump and his family's business associates and possible investors from Russia and other countries have violated U.S. laws against financing terrorism, money laundering and other illicit activities.

headline.main: Senator Asks Treasury to Examine Trump Foreign Associates
headline.print_headline: Senator Asks Treasury to Examine Trump Foreign Associates

docs.snippet: Seven months before a national election, the right-wing Alternative for Germany is losing voters while parties in neighboring countries with similar anti-immigrant platforms hold their own against mainstream rivals....
docs.lead_paragraph: Seven months before a national election, the right-wing Alternative for Germany is losing voters while parties in neighboring countries with similar anti-immigrant platforms hold their own against mainstream rivals.

headline.main: Germany's Divided Anti-Immigrant Party Faces Rocky Election Road
headline.print_headline: Germany's Divided Anti-Immigrant Party Faces Rocky Election Road

docs.snippet: Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp is nearing an agreement to plead guilty to U.S. criminal charges and pay hundreds of millions of dollars in penalties over allegations it violated U.S. laws that restrict sale of U.S. technology to Iran, a ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese telecom equipment maker ZTE Corp is nearing an agreement to plead guilty to U.S. criminal charges and pay hundreds of millions of dollars in penalties over allegations it violated U.S. laws that restrict sale of U.S. technology to Iran, a person familiar with the matter said.

headline.main: Exclusive: China's ZTE Expected to Plead Guilty Over Iran Sales-Source
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: China's ZTE Expected to Plead Guilty Over Iran Sales-Source

docs.snippet: Germany's Social Democrats (SPD) have seen a surge in new members, a further sign of the party's revival under new leader Martin Schulz who will face Chancellor Angela Merkel in a September election....

headline.main: German SPD Membership Surges With New Leader in Election Year
headline.print_headline: German SPD Membership Surges With New Leader in Election Year
